ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about geopolitics, social change, and global governance through each module and through conversations with visiting practitioners and professors.

I learned how to connect theories on grand strategy to actual strategy-making on real-world issues. The course also relied heavily on group work, so I gained more insights into effective collaborative work.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Would be improved by increasing conversations across modules and introducing the final briefing earlier in the semester. Would also be improved by lessening focus on social movements and increasing discussion of traditional grand strategy (i.e. geopolitics, economics, military, intelligence, national security strategy).

I really enjoyed learning from the practitioners -- it was refreshing to work with individuals who have been so successful in building social campaigns. I wish the time spent with practitioners, and the time spent developing the final brief, was longer though.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes absolutely. I learned a ton about contemporary geopolitical problems and how to frame my thinking around solutions to them. Interacting with the other students in the GS cohort was definitely a highlight of the program. The summer research project is also really cool and well funded -- it lets you uniquely explore any issue in the world that you are interested in and travel there to do so.
yes yes yes! apply for this course if you are even remotely interested in history & politics. the events outside of class have been one of the highlights of my semester!!

extras.title: GLBL 344 01/HIST 483J 01/PLSC 161 01 - Studies in Grand Strategy II
